abstract.para: This file provides documentation for file 95BOMONT.DAT, an ASCII file that contains final data for bryophyte tissue phosphorus and nitrogen concentrations in phosphorus fertilized reaches of the Kuparuk River in 1995.

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications
A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Kuparuk River: Control: 0.5 to -1.0 km Fertilized: 1.0 to 6.0 km

description.para:
For Archival Use:
DATE RECEIVED: June 1997 DATA FILE ENTERED BY: Karie Slavik DATA FILE VALIDATION: NAME: DATE

para.literalLayout: Nutrient concentrations in mosses (Hygrohypnum spp. and Schistidium agassizii) were monitored in P fertilized riffles in the Kuparuk River in 1995. Two samples per site were collected by combining 4-5 small clumps of each taxa from a 5 m^2 area in each riffle, rinsing thoroughly, and drying to a constant weight at 65 C. Samples were ground in a Wiley Mill to pass a #30 mesh and digested at 425 C with peroxide, potassium sulfate, copper sulfate, and hydrochloric acid. Digested samples were diluted with deionized water and analyzed for total phosphorus and nitrogen with an autoanalyzer. National Institute of Standards and Technology peach leaves were digested and analyzed to ensure the efficiency of digest and analytical procedures.

Notes: These data should not be released to any party without the written permission of William B. Bowden. (11) VARIABLE DESCRIPTIONS: Precise Coded? Variable Variable description Units (Y/N) SITE site of measurement y D/D river kilometer mark 0.05 n DATE date ddmmyy n LOCATION CONTROL, +P n SUBSITE POOL, RUN, or RIFFLE n SPECIES bryophyte species n %P percent phosphorus % n %N percent nitrogen % n COMMENTS data specific comments n

Reference Citations: Bowden, W.B., J.C. Finlay, and P.E. Maloney. 1994. Long-term effects of PO4 enrichment on the distribution of bryophytes in an arctic stream. Freshwater Biology 32:445-454. Finlay, J.C. and W.B. Bowden. 1994. Controls on production of bryophytes in an arctic tundra stream. Freshwater Biology 32:455-466.
